location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Lewis Pelly, Muscat to Narayn Wussadeojee

physicalDescription.extent: The letter book has been turned upside down and the correspondence relating to banking and financial matters has been entered from back to front, therefore the correspondence itself is upside down in relation to the folio numbers.

mods.abstract: Letter asking Narayn to visit Messrs Remington and settle the remaining 2-3000 rupees required to purchase the shares in the new bank of Bombay prior to the 1st March and asking him to visit the bank to ensure no mistakes have been made.The letter goes on to total the amount that Pelly is in Narayn's debt and to make arrangements for these debts to be paid as well as enquiring as to the potential value of Pelly's twenty shares in the old bank which have not yet been realised.
